title: Register for a Marathon
description: Find a marathon two weeks from now and register. Check for availability and registration deadlines.

title: Assess Current Fitness Level
description: Run a shorter distance (e.g., 5k or 10k) at your target marathon pace to gauge your current fitness and identify areas for improvement.

title: Create a Two-Week Training Plan
description: Develop a training plan focused on maintaining your current fitness level. Include shorter runs, rest days, and potentially some cross-training. Avoid high-intensity workouts or long runs to prevent injury.

title: Short Run and Strength Training
description: 3-5 mile run at a comfortable pace. Follow with a light strength training session focusing on core and legs.

title: Rest or Cross-Training
description: Take a complete rest day or engage in light cross-training activities such as swimming or cycling.

title: Tempo Run
description: Run 2-3 miles at a comfortably hard pace to maintain your speed and endurance.

title: Short Run and Stretching
description: Easy 3-mile run with focus on stretching and flexibility.

title: Longer Run (if appropriate)
description: If your assessment allows and you've been consistently running long distances, do a slightly longer run (no more than 10-12 miles) at an easy pace. Otherwise, stick to a shorter, comfortable run.

title: Easy Run
description: Short, easy run (3-4 miles) at a very comfortable pace.

title: Strength Training
description: Light strength training focusing on legs and core.

title: Rest or Cross-Training
description: Take a rest day or engage in light cross-training.

title: Rest
description: Full rest day before the marathon.

title: Marathon Day
description: Run the marathon! Pace yourself and listen to your body. Focus on finishing strong and enjoying the experience.
